1.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,

2.text: Ye know that after two days is [the feast of] the passover, and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.

3.text: Then assembled together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people, unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,

4.text: And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and kill [him].

5.text: But they said, Not on the feast [day], lest there be an uproar among the people.

6.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

7.text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat [at meat].

8.text: But when his disciples saw [it], they had indignation, saying, To what purpose [is] this waste?

9.text: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.

10.text: When Jesus understood [it], he said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.

11.text: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.

12.text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body, she did [it] for my burial.

13.text: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, [there] shall also this, that this woman hath done, be told for a memorial of her.

14.text: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,

15.text: And said [unto them], What will ye give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.

16.text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

17.text: Now the first [day] of the [feast of] unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover?

18.text: And he said, Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Master saith, My time is at hand; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.

19.text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them; and they made ready the passover.

20.text: Now when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.

21.text: And as they did eat, he said, Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

22.text: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Lord, is it I?

23.text: And he answered and said, He that dippeth [his] hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.

24.text: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man if he had not been born.

25.text: Then Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Master, is it I? He said unto him, Thou hast said.

26.text: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed [it], and brake [it], and gave [it] to the disciples, and said, Take, eat; this is my body.

27.text: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave [it] to them, saying, Drink ye all of it;

28.text: For this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.

29.text: But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.

30.text: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

31.text: Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended because of me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.

32.text: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.

33.text: Peter answered and said unto him, Though all [men] shall be offended because of thee, [yet] will I never be offended.

34.text: Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, That this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

35.text: Peter said unto him, Though I should die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.

36.text: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto the disciples, Sit ye here, while I go and pray yonder.

37.text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.

38.text: Then saith he unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: tarry ye here, and watch with me.

39.text: And he went a little further, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me: nevertheless not as I will, but as thou [wilt].

40.text: And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and saith unto Peter, What, could ye not watch with me one hour?

41.text: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed [is] willing, but the flesh [is] weak.

42.text: He went away again the second time, and prayed, saying, O my Father, if this cup may not pass away from me, except I drink it, thy will be done.

43.text: And he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.

44.text: And he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.

45.text: Then cometh he to his disciples, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take [your] rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

46.text: Rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray me.

47.text: And while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

48.text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he: hold him fast.

49.text: And forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and kissed him.

50.text: And Jesus said unto him, Friend, wherefore art thou come? Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

51.text: And, behold, one of them which were with Jesus stretched out [his] hand, and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest’s, and smote off his ear.

52.text: Then said Jesus unto him, Put up again thy sword into his place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.

53.text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father, and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels?

54.text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?

55.text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes, Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on me.

56.text: But all this was done, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him, and fled.

57.text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led [him] away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.

58.text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest’s palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.

59.text: Now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;

60.text: But found none: yea, though many false witnesses came, [yet] found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,

61.text: And said, This [fellow] said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.

62.text: And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what [is it which] these witness against thee?

63.text: But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.

64.text: Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.

65.text: Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy.

66.text: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

67.text: Then did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smote [him] with the palms of their hands,

68.text: Saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?

69.text: Now Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.

70.text: But he denied before [them] all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.

71.text: And when he was gone out into the porch, another [maid] saw him, and said unto them that were there, This [fellow] was also with Jesus of Nazareth.

72.text: And again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.

73.text: And after a while came unto [him] they that stood by, and said to Peter, Surely thou also art [one] of them; for thy speech bewrayeth thee.

74.text: Then began he to curse and to swear, [saying], I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.

75.text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.
